alert.note: Alert for Avery; Mitchell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 7:29PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Avery and Mitchell counties in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 725 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to slowly moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over the past hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area through 9 pm. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newland, Elk Park, Crossnore, Minneapolis and Altamont. Flooding will most likely along the North Toe River and associated tributaries, including along Reuben, Henson, and Birchfield Creeks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
